He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What do only some types of police do? You will have two hours to complete this challenge.<n>2. On your whiteboard, draw a rectangle (a 25x60 rectangle for the task) where every 60-second interval will begin.<n>3. At the top of your whiteboard write the task name in the box.<n>4. Your task should have a unique name.<n>5. The task name is not the only item written on the board.<n>6. You can write as much as you want, as long as the information will help you create a solution for the given task (including comments, notes, references...). For instance, you can create a flowchart by writing arrows and labels, or connect a lot of pictures by writing between them an explanation of the connections made.<n>7. There is not a specific task given for every challenge. You are free to choose any task you find interesting to complete, following the format above, and submitting as a challenge.<n>8. The submitted solutions should clearly demonstrate your creativity when solving a given challenge.<n>

How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What sport is the audience the loudest at? Choices:  A: show B: theatre C: hockey game D: movies E: event<n><n>### Response:		The audience is loudest at hockey games.<n><n>### Explanation:  Explanation:<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately answers the question below.<n>Input: There are 30 students in the gala.  Each student‚Äôs name rhymes with another student‚Äôs but not with their own.  At least 10 students are named Bob or Tom and at least 20 students are female.  Write a list of a student‚Äôs name and what their name rhymes with if they are in the gala.<n><n>Answer:  <n><n>### Exercise:<n><n>You do not need to write complete sentences.  You may submit any response that will get you a right answer according to the task you answered.<n><n>### Example:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:A government seeks what over it's people? Choices:  A: country B: trouble C: city D: sun E: control<n><n>### Response:		A: country (A = Country)<n>### Justification:<n><n>### Instructions:There are two questions to answer in this multiple choice task.<n>### Task:<n><n>### **Question 1:** The question prompt asks, "A government seeks what (A, B, C, D, or E)?" The answer they are looking for is B. Country is the correct answer as the government seeks to control or over them.<n><n>### Task:Given the following instruction, "A government seeeks what over it's [people]" and presented with the question prompt, "What does the government seek?" the correct answer is B [given the question, "over it's people" and presented with that choice].  <n>### **Question2:** The second question asks, "How long to boil an egg in a pot of water?" They want you to tell them in minutes. The correct answer would be 20 minutes (C). A: Country (A = Country)  <n>      B: Country (B = Country)  <n>  C: Trouble (C = Trouble)  <n>  D: Sun (D = Sun)  <n>  E: Control (E = Control) 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:The people wanted to take the scenic route, they chose the highway that cut through the what? Choices:  A: countryside B: united states C: beach D: atlas E: developed land<n><n>### Response:		<n>Their choice was inaccurate! It was neither A. nor C.! The beach is the land of the sea (like the sea route along the Mediterranean, or any sea-route). The united states are the land of the union (union as in the USA, or any union route)! The countryside lies on land. The land of the countryside is in the countryside.<n><n>### Input:"The two cities separated by 2000 miles and separated by 5 hours between them.<n><n>### Response:"Fly, travel by car, or take the train?<n><n>### Instructions:"If at least one of the two cities lies near a coastal, you can also choose to choose the coastal route as the third option.<n><n>### Questions:Who can help in the task? <n><n>### Solution:"What do you expect from him?" <n><n>

How many more miles did the bus travel the car?<n><n>-If you know the bus travels 95 miles in 60 minutes, then do you know the formula for the car?<n>- If you take both of vehicles 95 minutes, do you know its travel for both of them<n>- Do you know the total distance both of them travel?<n>- You know how many hours the bus takes the car to get to the destination. Do you know how many miles the bus takes the car?<n><n>

How much does her wages make per month?<n>```<n>144<n>```<n><n>input:Lisa and her friends are preparing a cake recipe. They add 2 cups of rice, 1 cup of milk but they are missing 1 cup of flour. They are a bit short and add 1 cup of white sugar just to make ends meet. They still have to add 3 cups of black chocolate and 3 cups of honey. What do they need to do to the recipe to complete it?<n>```<n>replace rice, milk, black chocolate and honey with equal amount of flour.<n>```<n><n>#### Input:<n>Lisa and her friends need to replace 3 cups of rice, milk, blackchocolate and honey.<n>With the ingredients they have, they are going to have a mix of 2 cups of flour and 1 cup each of rice, milk, and black chocolate left. <n>1 cup of black chocolate is the same as 1 cup of flours, since you are replacing it with your 3 cups of flour, you are left with 5 cups of flour. You will also notice the same relationship when replacing 3 cups of milk, it is the same amount as replacing it with 1 cup of flouns.<n>(2+1+1)-

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? The lead is enclosed in a cylindrical case called a holder, or sometimes encased in a protective sheath. The old meaning of to "take the lead" is to be a leader in any particular line of business<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question based on the provided data.<n><n>Input: What will Melanie need to roll to get a sum of 12? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input How many of the following are true about birds? Choices A: No.1 and 2 B: No. 1 and 3 C: No.1 and No.2 for D: No.3 and 4 E: No. 3 and 5 f: No. 4 and 5<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Input a: 12/4 = 2.17  b: 9/5 = 4.0  c: 2 √∑ 1/3 = 8.5 d: 88 √∑ 3 = 74.13  e: 15 -3.5 = 11.5  f: 1.0 + 0.2 = 1.2<n><n>### Response 6

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:I wanted  a side chair for people to visit me while I worked, where did I have it put? Choices:  A: building B: office C: library D: table E: bathtub<n><n>### Response:		The side chair could be used in A which is the building or B is the office or C is the library and D would be the table while E would be the bathtub.<n>### Input:What is a simple fraction?<n><n>### Response to Question:A simple fraction would be an area of some type or a count of some type.<n><n>#### Input:<n>What is a square root?<n><n>#### Response to Question:The square root is a part or a whole.<n><n>### Input:-45. Write a function that evaluates to a number without repeating.<n><n>### Response:-45<n><n>### Instructions:Write a program that has read a sequence of integers one at a time, and then outputs that sequence on the screen in reverse order.<n><n>### Output: 5 4 3 2 1<n><n>## Instruction:Write a program that prints the word "fruit." She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What is the biggest speech in the capital? Choices:  A: each state B: gettysburg address C: state of union D: each country E: europe<n><n>### Response:		A 	<n><n>### Input:"Cecelia was given five more than half of her grade point average"  Select the equation below that best reflects this statement. How would you write code to find the answer?<n><n>####Answer:<n>```<n> > var one = (138+139)<n>```<n><n>####Input:<n>Choose the correct equation to solve the math problem 2/3 + 1/3 = 2.<n>A:2 divided by 3 times 3= ______<n>B:1 divided by 3 times  2= _____<n>C:6 divided by 9 times 2= ______<n>D:(1+1/3) divided by (2/3)=  _______<n><n>####Response:A<n><n>####Input :Let's say you have the number 23 written in a variable. How would you subtract 4 from this number? Example:<n>```<n>>var i = 23<n>>var j = 4<n>>i - j<n>>19<n>>i - (1/2) * j<n>>18.5<n>>(i - j / 2) + (i - j / 4)<n>>15.5<n>```

Choices:  A: appear suddenly B: bottom out C: go downtown D: scream E: roll over<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: appear suddenly<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A: I was standing at the front of the dealership when all of a sudden I felt a salesman walk in front of me. I wasn't sure he saw me. I'm sure he never even heard me. That's what salesmen do. It's what they're trained to do. They appear suddenly.<n><n>### Input(s):<n>I was looking through my wallet with a friend, when all of a sudden she started to run her fingers across my hair. What did she start to do?<n><n>### Answer(s):<n>Suddenly. It's also very possible that she was about to begin singing but stopped when she found my hair.<n><n>### Expected Answer 1:<n>I was standing in line for a water bottle. All of a sudden the cashier started screaming. I was startled.<n><n>### Answer 1:<n>A: The cashier suddenly screamed. Everyone was startled in the store.<n><n>### AI:<n>Answer: A<n>We're trying to do better at teaching robots to read human behavior and infer actions from facial expressions through machine learning techniques, so a couple of interesting things happened. First off, the response answers the question correctly, but also includes an explanation for _why_ it got its answer correct, something that is difficult for robots to explain due to the nature of their process model. An even more interesting result is in the third paragraph, where the question and response both include the word "all of a sudden." It is apparent that we don't want the robot to simply guess on words like "suddenly" and "appear," and would prefer not to have to model hundreds of thousands (perhaps millions) of unique sequences of words and symbols, with the aim of recognizing a "sudden" in a sentence when it occurs. We don't know which robots got it right and which got it wrong. So this answer seems particularly impressive.<n><n>### B

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. What is the heaviest person on the boat?<n><n>### Instructions - Use a calculator if your school allows one.<n><n>### Input - I will be providing you with 3 digits. At a minimum, your instructions should include an explanation of: <n>What is the purpose? <n>What information is provided and what information is needed?<n><n>### Demos<n>- Write a document that documents your steps, or "happy path", and what you will present in the demo. <n>- Write a script that includes the information in your document. <n><n>### Documentation<n>- Develop a document that should:<n>-   Include your script (with your variable names)<n>-   Detailed annotations of the script (your variable names with explanations and descriptions)<n>-   A demo (video) of the script in action<n>-   A detailed list of the variables that are included in the data file<n>-   A sample example of the data file including your variable names and explanations and descriptions<n>-   A detailed explanation of how to use your script. This includes how to execute the script, and an explanation on how to process the resulting data file. <n>

Choices:  A: more rice B: own house C: warm coat D: light up E: read book<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Why<n>#### Explanation:A lot of ways to relax is BUT, therefore it is simply opening ONE.<n><n>### Input<n>#### Explanation:`The most beautiful women in the world` is a phrase with BUT in it, therefore it is simply looking at THE MOST BEAUTIFUL WOMEN.<n><n>### Response<n>#### Explanation:'The most beautiful women in THE WORLD' is a phrase with ANNOTATOR in it, therefore it must simply be looking at THE MOST.<n><n>### Explanation:The rest of the question is BUT. For the first sentence, it is a sentence fragment because it doesn't end with a period. For the second, it contains 2 sentences, so it is a run-on and needs to be separated with a comma or a period and a semi-colon.

They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where do you wait in a reception area for a meeting? Choices:  A: hall B: motel C: hotels D: law firm E: office building<n><n>### Response:		E - office building<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:How would someone feel after going for run? His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where can you see a mammoth in NYC? She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Along what feature will you find a rosebush? Choices:  A: park B: in the ground C: hedgerow D: temperate climate E: botanical gardens<n><n>### Response:		<n>E<n><n>**Explanation**<n>Roses can be found in many areas along hedgerows, gardens, and other places.<n><n>***<n><n><n><n>https://www.education.com/lesson-plan/common-core-2nd-grade-math/addition/<n><n><n>### Input<n>How many more strawberries do you have if you eat 8 of the 15 and the other 7 are still in your house?<n><n>### Response<n><n>You have 7<n><n>### Explanation:<n>You started with 15 and ate 8 of them<n><n>15-8=7<n><n><n>-------------------------------<n><n>https://smarthomeschool.com/pages/common-core-homework-help-paris-and-sabrina<n><n><n>### Problem:<n><n>How can you compare the weights of different objects? <n><n>### Examples:<n><n>If you have two identical objects (with the same shape and material) we can say that they are the same weight but we can‚Äôt say that they have the same mass because it depends on what you have as a reference. If you have two different objects with the same mass and the same material, you can decide that they are different, but you can‚Äôt decide that they are of different weight because it depends on what distance you have between them. <n><n>We can use several different methods.<n><n>* If we use two scales we can say that the object that it is more heavy is heavier.<n><n>* If you have three scales you will be able to compare different objects. On the scales you can see how much weight each can bear. <n><n>* If you use something to measure the distance between objects you will be able to say how much more are one object in relation to the other one.  A meter stick or a ruler can be used or even a hand of a person<n><n>Example 1<n><n>* 3kg (the heaviest one on the left) > 2kg (the one on the right) > 1kg (the lightest object) >.5kg (the lighter one)<n><n>Example 2<n><n>*  1 meter stick:  0,40kg (the one on top) and  0,35kg (the one on bottom) >  0

If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:You weren't suppose to touch the wild animals, they could what? Choices:  A: lie down B: run away C: bite D: keep alive E: feel pain<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:  This is a multi-part question. In each section of this multiple choice question, you will be given an unsolved equation and the requested number of digits in the solution will be shown.  It may be helpful to first solve the same equation to verify that your solution is correct. Write 0 if the question is impossible to answer.<n><n>### Section 1 :<n>Input: You were suppose to solve the following equation but forgot one number. How many digits are in your incomplete solution?<n><n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Section2 :<n>Input: You have solved the following equation and gotten the correct digits. What is the value of your missing digit?<n><n>### Section3 :<n>Input: You don't know which of two possible values your missing digit should be in the following equation.  Which one would you guess was correct and why?<n><n>You found the value and the value was:<n><n>### Section4 :<n>Input: You are given three values that you think are all possible values your missing digit could be.  Which value is not one of them and why?<n><n>### Instructons:  Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Instuctions:Answer only one of the following questions.<n><n>### Multiple choice Q1<n><n>### Multiple Choice Q2<n><n>### MultipleChoice Q3<n><n>### MultipleChoicce Q3<n><n>## MultipleChoice Qu<n><n><n>## MultipleCh<n><n>## Multipl<n><n>## MultiplQ<n><n>## Multip<n><n>## MultipQu<n><n>## Multipuli<n><n>## MultipleChoice<n><n><n>### Instuctons:  Input: If a man buys 12 bananas, there are 27 bananas for every 4 oranges, and a bushel of bananas equals a bushel of oranges, then how many bananas does a bushel of banana have? Answer: 4 bananas<n><n>## Constraints: <n>## <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If 3.0% of the population is over the age of 65, what percentage of the population is under the age of 14?<n>(2.3% * 0.77 = 1.76)<n><n>### Solution:<n>0.77 - (0.03 + 0.17) =  0.67 is approximately 6.7%<n><n>### Input :  What is the square root of the number 2?<n><n>### Solution :<n>(1.414213 + 1.414595)<n><n>### Input & Output:  In the sentence, if we took the letter "g" and moved it to before the sentence, it would be called what? Choices: A: a sentence B: a word C: an independent clause D: grammar E: a question mark<n><n>### Solution  :<n>B<n><n>### Example:<n>G is an independent clause in the sentence.  If we remove it, the sentence becomes a question mark.<n><n>### Input 1: What is the least common multiple (L. C. M.) of the two numbers? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demostration:<n>You can access this solution by downloading the Python solution files on GitHub.<n>### Instruction answer:<n><pre>A</pre><n><n>### Demo answer code below<n><n>```<n>import sys<n><n>ans = "tears"    # Define variable ans to be the answer.<n>inp = sys.stdin.readline().rstrip("\n\r")  # read the input.<n>if inp.lower() == "harder":<n>    ans = "anguish"<n>elif inp.lower() =="bitterness":<n>    ans = 'bitterness"<n>else:<n>    ans = "tears"<n><n>print(ans)<n>```<n><n>### Demo execution:<n><n>```<n>$ python answer.py<n>1. Tears<n>```<n><n>## A. 95 is evenly divided by 6.<n>How many pairs of equal numbers can 95 be evenly divided by?<n><n>### Solution:<n>95 is evenly divisible by 6 2 times.<n><n>![](https://github.com/pythonBloggg/pythonBloggg.github.io/raw/master/assets/95%20is%20evenly%20divided%20by%206.(GIF).gif)<n><n>### Solution Code:<n>

If he wears one pair of work boots at a time and each pair of fancy dress shoes are worn once a week, the shoes will last one year. If Tom wears each pair of fancy dress shoe for 2 weeks at a time and the work boots are to last two years, what was the longest amount of time he could have a shoe for?<n>### Response:(1 year)<n>### Input:Tom had an odd number of marbles. At the end of the day he gave some marbles to his brother who also has an odd amount. The new total of marbles was still odd. The total of the odd numbers the boys have now is 21 more than the original number Tom had and he gave his brother no more than half of his original number of marbles. How many marbles did Tom have to begin with?<n>### Response:12<n>### Input:A 10-meter stick is two feet shorter than a 12-meter stick. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Choices:  A: car B: fuel system C: accelerate D: boat E: airplane<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A: Car<n><n>### Input<n>The word problem is about a student that works and goes to school. The student worked 2 hours each day after the classes and worked 9 hours overall in the week. At school, the student spent 6 hours in the classes and studied for 30 minutes at home. How many hours did the student go back and forth between the school and their workplace?<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: 9 hours<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Demonstrate your understanding of the word problem.<n><n>### Input <n><n>Jake had 14 coins but he gave away 9 of them. So, he ended up a net value of 12. He still has the same 12 dollars in coins. How much is each coin is worth?<n><n>### Output<n><n>A: 1 dollar per coin<n><n>### Input I<n><n>The student was thinking about what are the greatest number of 3 digits positive.<n><n>### Output I<n><n>A: 800<n><n>### Input II<n><n>The student read the number of 3 digits and they are thinking if it is greater than 799 or less.<n><n>### Response II<n><n>A: Less<n><n>### Input III<n><n>The student has only one more digit to solve the problem. The student has already determined if the number is positive.<n><n>## Tested Code<n><n>**Solving the word problem**<n><n>```javascript<n>console.log("Your answer is " + solve());<n>``` <n>**Input** <n><pre class="prettyprint"><n><n>console.log("Input 1:");<n>console.log(input1);<n>console.log();<n><n>console.log();console.log();console;<n>console.log();solve();<n>console.log();next_input();<n><n>console.group("Input II");<n>console.log("");console.log("Input I:");<n>console.table(inputI);<n>console.log("Output:",outputI);<n><n>console.groupEnd();<n><n>console.table("Daily Average Calculation");<n>console.log(); 14-9;solve();<n>console;<n><n>console.groupStart("Input III");<n>console.log(`Input III: ${inputIII.join(', ')}`

How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:The person gave a good hands on what to show how to do the work? A grumpy person is likely to have a headache so option A is false. A grumpy is rarely happy and rarely understands others, option E is false then they would not be grumpy. Grumpy people hate compliments, so option C is false. Lastly D is true so they are very possible to have a house.<n><n>

(int, int)<n>3.  (char array)<n>4.  (string array)<n><n>### Demo: <n>Input: <n>1.  (int, char, char)`enter code here`<n>2.  (4,3)<n>3.  ("S","o",")<n>4.  ("hello", " ")<n><n>### Response<n><n>1. <n>```<n>     int x; char y; char z;<n>     int add(int x, char z, char y){<n>    	return (x + z)* y<n>     }<n>     char  concat(char z, char y, char x){<n>    	 return  z+y+x<n>     }<n>     int  cal(int x, char y, char z){<n>    	 return x + (y * z)<n>     }<n>```<n><n>2.<n>```<n> int x=4;<n> int y=3;<n> <n> int add2(int x, int y){<n> 	return (x + y);<n> }<n> <n> int sub2(int x,  int y){<n>  return(x - y);<n> }<n>```<n><n>3. <n>```<n>      char [] word[]={"hello"," "," ", " ", " ", NULL}<n>```<n><n>4.<n>```<n>      string [] word[]={"hellelo "," "," ", " " }<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:The fat man refused to accept what was possible, he complained that he what the simplest activities? If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:They were getting together for the big game, he wasn't hosting but made sure to bring pretty of food with him over to where? He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Family history <n><n>### Response : Jane's job and favorite restaurant are the two things that Tom found out about Jane from Jane's co-worker.<n><n>###Instruction:<n>A. Use the provided information to answer the following question. How many letters are in the word, ÔøΩspaghettiÔøΩ?<n><n>```python<n>b ='spaghetti in the restaurant'<n>l_spaghetti,l_restaurant,l_in = 6,3,3<n>ans_l_spaghetti_len,ans_l_in_len = 1,2<n><n>ans2=b''.join([l_spaghetti]*len(l_in))<n><n>```<n><n>###Solution : In this question, we were told that that the word, "spaghetti", was 2 larger in length than the word, "in", and that the words, "spaghetti" and "in" were connected and that the words "in the restaurant" appeared 3 total times after the connected words. We also were given the total length of the word, "spag" and three other smaller words, 'in' and 'the restaurant'. Now, we can look through our data and find that the number of letters that are in the words, "In the restaurant" are 4 letters smaller than the other 3 letters that it is attached to. Also, we can notice that we have been given that the longest word in the sentence is "in", the next longest is "spaghetti" while the next 2 words with the length of 3 to attach to are "the restaurant." Using this information we can conclude that the answer to our question is the number 2, because the word, "in" has twice as many letters as the word "spaghetti" which can also be connected to the word with two times as many letters as "spaghetti" to conclude that it has twice the number of letters as "spaghett

Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer is E <n><n>### Input : There are 5 people in a class.  The teacher is assigning seats according to 5 rules.  First, everyone sits directly across from one of the other four people in the class.  Second, the person who sits in the middle seats is not next to anyone else in the class.  Third, the person on the end sits next to the person who has an odd numbered name.  Fourth, the person who s has an odd numbered last name is not next to the person who s has the opposite last name.  Fifth, the only person who s has a number in their last name of less than 5 sits next to the only person with a last name of more than five digits.  Which two students are next to each other?<n><n>### Response :<n><n>Sam is in the front-right of the classroom (according to the list), so she sits next to Bob. Bob has an even last name, so he must sit next to Matt. Matt‚Äôs name starts with an S and is odd in length, so he sits next to Lisa. Lisa has an even number in her last name, so she does not sit next to John. The only other odd numbered name in the classroom is Jake, so he must sit somewhere other than the position for his name<n><n>### Instuction:Answer the following true-false question.<n><n>False<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Dick had $60. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Janet knew she was dying from her injuries because she could feel herself doing what? Choices:  A: sleeping longer B: getting cold C: death and decay D: change of color E: stop breathing<n><n>### Response:		She knew she was dying because she was experiencing changes in her body. She could feel herself breathing less, and she felt cold.<n><n><n><n>

Write an expression that solve this problem: A store sells a watch for 22% off list price. At this sale price a customer may buy 1 watch per day (40% off list price). If 4 customers come in tomorrow to buy watches, how many watches will be sold tomorrow?<n><n>### Output: 1*[22% - 40%]*4 + 0 = 199%<n><n>### What is a pattern of the given input and output?<n><n>(1) How old is Lori? Lolo = 666 years old<n><n><n><n>### Input to Math Formula: 1)  How old is Lori.  Lori = 16 years old  2) How old is Lucy. Lucy = 9 years old.<n><n>## Output Letters to Math Formulas:(4) How old is Lana?  Lana = 66 years old.  5) How

They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:He was a very sharp engineer, but when it came to the details his calculations could were often what? Choices:  A: complimentary B: inelegant C: ocean D: dull E: inaccurate<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think the right answer is ocean because I was looking for the synonym for sea. Sea: water body that is partially in the sea. So I thought that it could be water, but after thinking about it a bit it could be ocean instead.<n><n>```python<n>Answer:  ocean<n>```<n>### Input:Anna was on vacation on the beach and she needed to get back to work. She could take a boat, a train, a bus, or walk.  She'll only take the train if she doesn't have to take a bus, and she'll only walk if she has to take the boat. How should Anna get back to work?<n><n>### Response<n><n>```python<n><n>Answer:  train<n>```<n>You would think that its a train because she wont take a bus or walk.<n>If she wouldn't take the bus and wont walk.<n>Then she would just take the train.<n>And since we know that she can take the train.<n>Then we know that her first step is to get on the boat.<n>And if she didn't have to take the boat she would just take the bus.<n>Since we can't get to the train without getting on a boat then she would have to take the boat to get to the train after she walks to her first stop the boat.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>You want to buy the newest iPhone but it costs $200.  You only have $140 in your savings account.  You can put $50 more in your savings account or sell one of your watches.  One of your watches is not worth more than $50.  How much does one of your watches have to be worth to afford the new iPhone and add $50 to the savings account?<n><n>### Your answer:<n><n>I think that the answer that they are looking for is either that you don't buy the iphone until you get your next paycheck or they are looking for $80.<n>The reason is that if they ask about one of your watches then they must be worth something. If one of your watches is worth more than $100 they would have asked you if it could be that expensive. Then you would have to keep saving for your next paycheck or you could just sell a cheaper one to get only $80.<n><n>```python answer =

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:The electric motor powered many important things, including one if almost every house. Choices:  A: unimportant B: insignificant C: stellar D: somewhat E: helpless<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>It took a group of 3 people 15 hours to work on a project. At that rate the entire group took a total of how much time working on the project? Choices: 120 hrs 140 hrs 160 hrs 180 hrs<n><n>### Response<n>180<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Which of the following word phrases correctly complete the sentence that describes the task?<n><n>### Instructor's note:This question is formatted as a "Fill In the Blank", where a subject is chosen from the list and it's response is chosen from one of the five choices. <n><n>### Options<n>(A) "mighty"<n><n>(B) "(the) vast night sky"<n><n>(C) "unimportant"<n><n>(D) "stellar"<n><n>(E) "insignificant"<n><n>### Options Responses:<n>Choice A is Correct<n><n>### Instucture:<n>The student is given information about a number and asked ‚ÄúHow much does the student have remaining?‚Äù This can be answered through two different methods:<n>1.  Counting up or 2. Counting backwards. <n><n>## Evaluate<n>-If students are answering using the correct method, they need to be reminded that "less," "fewer" and "none of" are not words that can be used in equations<n>-Ask students to identify what method they are going to use to arrive at an answer to their equation. (Counting up or Counting down)<n>-The student who chooses to count up needs to identify the operation sign (eg. +, -, multiplication, division) <n><n>-The student who counts down, needs to identify the total number of things, and then count backwards to reach to the 0.<n><n>```python<n>#Example: Mary had 8 sticks and she used 3 stick on each page of her journal.<n><n>total_remaining = total - used = 8*3=24 - 3 =18<n><n># Example: Zach is saving his $100 to buy a $100 bike.<n><n>#Remaining = total - current, total = $100, current = (amount spent) - $0<n><n>rem

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? Choices:  A: boredom B: patience C: time D: teachers E: inspiration<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer:** [B] **Citation:** [B1] [D1] [D2]<n>* B is a noun that refers to what people feel when performing monotonous tasks.<n>* B1 is a verb that refers to the emotion of patience.<n>* D1 is the word "that" which is used to show possession.<n>* D2 is the pronoun "it" which is used to refer to a noun.<n><n>### Input:[The boss sent in an employee for an investigation.] The employee was told to sit down while [the boss] prepared a presentation. The entire presentation was [the boss] expressing the importance of the company and [the employee] listening. After being done, the boss told the [employee] that he was the boss and the [employee] had to do as he said.<n><n>### Comment:**It's not that bad.**<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>* Answer the following:<n>	1. Which instance was the boss making a point?<n>	5. Which instance was the [employee] listening?<n><n><n><n><n><n>### [Feedback to: Below is an instruction that describe a task. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What do you need to be to learn hard concepts? Choices:  A: copy B: intelligent C: improved performance D: empowering E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		The word ‚Äòto understand‚Äô means having a knowledge of or informed opinion about a subject. The word ‚Äòunderstand‚Äô indicates that you have knowledge about something.<n><n>### Input<n>>The total monthly salary of Sam and David is 4600 INR but David has a high loan burden which is 500 INR each month, in such cases what is the minimum amount of money that Sam should give to David to fulfill this expenditure.<n><n>### Response<n>I understand your problem clearly.I think if Sam pay 1050 INR a month to David so there is no problem with him he should pay that amount.<n><n>### AI:Write a python program that reads the inputs from the text file and then write a python function to find the prime factor if given input. The output should be on the prompt in the text as well.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```<n>   input = 6428571<n>   while(input >0)<n>   {<n>    if(input % 2 ==0):<n>    print(True)<n>    else:<n>    print(False)<n><n>    input = input /2<n>```<n><n>### Output:False<n>### Problem: Write a python function to check whether a number is prime or not.<n>```<n>   def isPrime(input):<n>    if input>1:<n>        if input % 2 == 0:<n>         return False<n>         else:<n>            return True<n><n>    else:return()<n><n>isPrime(3)<n>```<n><n>## AI:<n><n>```<n>input = [13,2,3,9,4,19,8,6,11]<n>def isOdd(input):<n>    total = 0<n>    while True:<n>        total = total % 2<n>        if total ==0:return('even')<n>        elif input % 2 ==1 and input % 3 ==0:<n>        return('odd')<n>```<n><n>## Output:Odd<n><n>## AI<n>```<n>num = 98805<n>primeFactor = [98,80,5]<n>print(primeFactor)<n>```<n><n>Answer: I think this data is correct.<n><n>### Output<n><n>```<n>1 5 2672
