Choices:  A: restaurant B: congress C: envelope D: mail box E: cheese store<n><n>### Response:		 "D"<n><n>**Explanation:**<n><n>If the answer is letter 'A', then you will find them in a restaurant. We know this because it's mentioned in my question. If the answer is letter 'B', then you will find bills on cheese. Cheese is mentioned in my question like bills are mentioned as a form of bread. If the answer is 'C', then we'll find bills in the congress. It says in the question that 'bills with bread' so the answer is 'C'.<n><n>If the answer was letter 'D', that's not a plausible answer to me and there's a plausible answer that is 'E'. Bread with bills are mentioned in my question. The answer is letter 'E'.<n><n>## Task 1<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input:<n><n>Input: You are given 50 minutes to do your homework. People tell jokes when they feel stressed and they feel relaxed. b. People don't tell many jokes anymore. c. People tell jokes because they have nothing else to do. d. People tell jokes to let us feel happy and positive. e. Jokes are more funny when they are funny in a way that nobody else thinks.<n><n>### Response The correct answer is: c.<n><n>### How long does it take for some jokes to become a joke? Choice:    a. three and four c. two days b. It is impossible to determine when a joke happens to people because laugh can make jokes funnier or weirder c. It depends on what jokes 1 know because there are some people who don't have enough sense of humour  to understand jokes.<n><n>### What does happiness make people do? Choices:  d. Happiness makes people laugh, cry, and jump e. Happiness makes them laugh and cry. f. Happiness makes us angry. g. Both of them make people laugh and cry.<n><n>### Correct answer is: d.<n><n>### Happiness is a funny thing. People don't laugh when they are tired. I don't know why. I am the one who is tired but 1 can't stop laughing when my friends laugh.  How long will humor last? Choices:   d. laughs can last for a short time e. laughs can last forever f. laugh is as short as a joke g. laughs can last as long as the time before it<n><n>### The correct answer is: e.<n><n>### Joy brings happiness and laughter to any day. A short-term happiness, or a lasting one? Choices:   c. A lasting one d. A short-term e. Not sure<n><n>### The short answer is: c. The lasting happiness is the only type happiness.<n><n>### A question is: what is laughter? Choices:   a. Laughter, in a way, is something that we don‚Äôt understand b. It is just another form of human emotions c. It is like an expression

How many trees are there if there is 29 lawns?<n><n>### Demostration:Total mileage plus 18 equals 24 plus (total lawns plus 2 times the total runners) equals (29 lawns plus 11 trees) plus (total runners minus two times Mary who was more than Mary and her sister). How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What's the nickname of the monster the beauty loved? Choices:  A: beast B: ugly C: ugliness D: satellite E: top of mountain<n><n>### Response:		Ugliness<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>You are standing at the base of a mountain.  The mountain rises steeply from the base and rounds as it continues upward.  You are trying to find the top using a compass and a clinometer. <n><n>A compass shows the directions of north, south, east, and west.<n>A clinometer shows the incline, or angle, at which you are standing with respect to the ground.<n><n>You estimate that you are 100 feet, $latex 100-foot, $ bottom from the mountain's peak. You climb up the mountain at a steady pace and keep track of your distance from the peak. Every 10 feet you will look away from the mountain ridge to the right and left to get your distance.<n><n>Let $latex t-time, $ bottom be the amount of time it takes you to climb up the mountain, <n>and $latex h-height, $ bottom be your distance, measured in height, from the mountain peak as you are climbing.<n><n>You know that the number of times your distance changes will be the number of times $latex t-time. $<n><n>Given your distance from the peak after $latex t-time $ hours, write a program that finds the distance (in feet) to the summit.<n><n>Input:<n><n>the number of times your distance will change as you climb<n><n>Output:<n><n>the distance from the top of the mountain to your peak<n><n>Example input $latex1-10\times 20\rangle t\rangle h\rangle<n><n>Distance from the top of the monent to you<n><n>Example output: h $latex=5-11\rangle 8\rangle 9\rangle 45\rangle 111\rangle <n><n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where is a telephone booth likely to be red? Choices:  A: airport B: gotham city C: london D: city E: gas stations<n><n>### Response:		D <n><n>### Instructions:Use the given inputs to create your own mathematical expressions. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What is someone unintentionally hurting someone else but unable to stop likely to feel? Choices:  A: empowering B: regret C: despair D: glee E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		C<n>- Regret - Feeling sad - you might want to do something you're sorry about<n><n>### Input 2: What does having a disaster recovery and backup plan for your company help prevent? Choices: A: losing information B: information loss C: data loss D: data loss prevention<n><n>### Response 2:B<n>- Information loss prevention - this helps protect your data and prevent loss of data.<n><n>### Input<n>Josh has 7 books in his shelf. One of them is a novel, two of them are magazines, and four of them are comic books. If there are even number of comic books in his shelf, what is the sum of the odd numbers of books in the shelf?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Ans: 7<n><n>### Input2<n>If 7 apples cost 3 pounds of sugar, what is the price of 3 pounds of sugar?<n><n>Ans: $12<n><n><n>---<n><n># Solution<n>- ### Instruction:<n>- For multiple choice question we can use this function or operator to get the right answer:<n>- 1. If the number on the top is negative it always means the question is a math question and we can simply use `if()` operator to check if it is negative or not.<n>- 2. Other than that, we can use the if condition `if (question_num < 1) return 0; else return answer;` to check for each question if it is greater than or equal to 1 or not.<n>- If it is above 1, return the answer. Otherwise, return 0<n>- - Here * is the index of question,<n>- *if (question_num * 10 === answer) return 0;<n>- - We can also use `if()` operator and this is the same answer as the code above<n>- - `if (question_10 % 10 === answer%10)`<n>- - `else return 0`<n>- ---<n><n>*If it is negative, return the question itself.<n>---<n><n>### Instructions:<n>![Image](Img/test.png)<n><n>### Solution to Instructions<n>- [Solution](https://github.com/DongZhengLi/DongZhongLi-Portfolio/

Choices: -25 * 3 A: 5 * -1 B: 5 * -3 C: 4 -2 * -3 D: x E: 2 x - 3<n><n>### Response<n>I am looking for negative number 75. However, I cannot figure out negative 25 times 3 to be 75. Therefore, the expression is not equal to -75.<n>-25 = -25<n>-25 times 3 = -25 * 5 (-5 * -2) = -25 * -3 because -5 times -2 is 10<n>-25 times -3 = -75<n><n>### Input<n>A store is offering a 30% discount on items. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where in your home would you store birth control pills near your toothpaste? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: chemist's shop C: kitchen D: drug store E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I would store birth control pills at the kitchen.<n><n>Input:How many gallons of gasoline does it take to fill a 27 gallon tank.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The answer is 26.<n><n>Input:A 50 foot string with a wasp is tied to a 20 foot stick with 20 more string. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. What is the best strategy that they can use to win the game?<n><n>### Input / Response:<n><n>It's a hot day, you know when a rain is going to come. You need to know how long it takes for one drop of rain to reach the Earth's surface. If you know the atmospheric pressure, the surface temperature of the Earth and the height of the clouds, what mathematical equation do you need to solve to get information on rain time?<n><n>### In/Res:<n><n>A person is making a graph. They need to show the temperature at each minute during the day. What interval should they use to do this if the temperature changes slowly?<n><n>### Inst/Res:<n><n>Ned is trying out a new chores strategy for his apartment. Each Monday his roommates clean their individual messes. Ned cleans one of the rooms once every three days. Ned decides to change his schedule and does each room's workload as his roommates do it. Should Ned take this new routine?<n><n>I think he should keep going by his old routine.<n>* The first day of the new routine Ned would have to clean 4 rooms. But the next day because he would be busy and the day after he didn't do anything. So, he would only clean half of each room. The days after are the same as the old routine.<n><n>### In / Res:<n><n>Anna and George want to buy a pizza for a dinner party for two of them. They decide to share whatever toppings are on the pizza, except if two toppings aren‚Äôt equally shared, George eats more cheese next time to make it fair.  They decide to share equally at the start and then George eats more cheeses next time if need be.  Should that be equal? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:He called bull when his friend said a bull can be what? Choices:  A: feeble B: bullbleep C: cow D: female E: charging prey<n><n>### Response:		C.Feeble.<n>Answer A choice b and c are incorrect, option d is incorrect because the word BULL here refers a male bovine, and option<n><n>### Input:'Do you like it?', said Mom. - Mom had made this new pizza crust recipe which I'd never eaten before. How much money did they have left?<n><n>###  <n>Choices:  A: $12<n>B: $22.50<n>C: $9.50<n>D: $4.50<n>E: $28<n><n><n>### Input<n>There is a large number of sheep in a large field. You are given a group of shepherds in order to herd the sheep into the pens.  Each shepherd has a different number and name. In addition, each shepherd performs a set of commands.  Some commands require that the shepherd to move to the next sheep in the queue, some commands require that the shepard takes their dog and places it in their spot, and other commands simply direct them to walk away in a random direction.<n><n>### Input. <n>15 shepherds on the field and each doing different behaviors to the sheep:<n><n>1: Go to the sheep with a red collar.<n>2: Move to the next sheep.<n>3: Walk in a direction chosen by a number up to 31 (N,S,E,W)<n>4: Move the sheep to a queue.<n>5: Wait until the last command has been performed then move to the next sheep with a red collor.<n><n>These fifteen shepherds must perform a set of commands in sequential order. If a shepherd fails to perform these commands then she must follow the next command that is passed down to her.<n><n>### Output<n>Given commands to an amount of shepherds (min 3,max 30), the shepherds are placed on the field.  If a set of commands are carried out correctly then all shepherds must remain where they were placed in the field.<n>### Instructions<n>Create a program where we run a simulation for different instances of commands to determine the final outcome of all shepherds in the field.<n><n>### Question<n>How would you determine where commands go if they are being randomly assigned to a new position every time it fails?<n><n>### Additional Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions<n>

What is the ratio of girls to boys in grade 9? Choices: 1:2 A: 2:1 or 5:2 B: 3:4 or 6:4 C: 3:5 or 7:5 D: 4:5 or 8:5<n><n>### Response(2):In grade 9 there are more boys than girls.<n><n><n>## Part 3: <n>### Instruction 3: The man doesn't like getting out bed and stepping on cold tile, so he put carpeting. Where did he put carpet?<n># Write a recursive algorithm for this problem if required. In the winter, I do not take Fido outside because I know he would slip and get injured if he went outside.<n>-If it is sunny out, Fido, needs to go outside.<n>-If the temperature is below 20¬∞F, Fido cannot go outside because he will get too cold.<n>-Otherwise, Fido should go outside if I woke him up and he goes out for potty, or if it has been too long since he has been out.<n><n>-If I eat my dinner, I'll have to clean up.<n>-If I am not eating my dinner, I will clean up.<n>-I do not need to clean up if someone else messes up my dinner or if I am already cleaning up.<n><n>### Note: <n><n>-If no if/then statement is given, then a decision or decision method must be made.<n><n><n>### Note2<n><n>-If no decision or decision method is given, then you must determine whether to take action or not.

Choices:  A: eat fish B: they steal C: talk to each other D: write stories E: die of starvation<n><n>### Response:		 B.<n><n>### Input and Response:<n>How long does it take to boil an egg?<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The input is that it takes one to boil an egg. The output is half of that time. For the above answer of 40 minutes, 40 minutes divided by 2 comes out to be 20 minutes. Which is the same as the input.<n><n>### Bonus Questions:<n><n>#### Input:If it takes 19 minutes to boil an egg, how long does it take to cook food in the microwave?<n>#### Response:  <n>Explanation:<n><n>### Input Answer to the previous:  <n>The answer is 5, or 5 minutes.<n><n>### Question:How much would you pay for someone to cook dinner, given that they will always cook it faster than if you do it yourself and thus save you time? Would you want to make a deal with someone who doesn't know how to cook? Would you expect to pay more if you know the person and trust them to do a good job? How about if their food smells terrible? Would that affect how much they charge, even if the food would be better for you? Do you think they'd charge a lower price for dinner or higher? Now, given that you would expect the same personality to be willing to cook for you as would clean your home, would how much you pay depend on what percentage of your time you spend cleaning your home?<n><n>#### Response: <n>Yes, there are benefits to outsourcing. However, outsourcing can be quite expensive if an individual outsources tasks that are not highly specialized, or that would be more efficient to do in house. Moreover, there are costs involved aside from paying a service provider. It is inefficient to outsource things that are simple for an individual to complete in house. This is because it is not cost effective in terms of time to complete the task (if it takes longer to complete the work than pay an outsourcing service than it is more cost effective to keep one of the company's employees busy rather than hiring an outsourcing company to save time).<n><n>I do believe that a person who is willing to clean my house is willing to prepare my food for me if I am willing to pay them. If they are capable of preparing food for me

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>I can't believe that's a real question.<n><n>## Solution:<n>For each question, we can create a variable for the question, the possible answers, and which one is the answer.<n>For the question on the number of legs of an animal of kangaroos and a group of animals.  Each animal can have either _(2 legs)_ or _(4 legs)_. There is a total of _(23)_ kangaroo's and _(3)_ more goats _(4 legs) than kangaroos (2 legs)_ each.  The total number of legs is therefore _(23)_ + _(3)_ = 26.<n><n>For the question on how many candles it is on the birthday cake.  <n>We can start with the question: It's _(36)_ birthdays (each with four candles per each birthday).  So for each _(36)_ candles, there are _(4)_ possible answers.  This question is similar to that of the birthday cake on page 45 of the textbook, which is why the answer is given for it.  So there are 4 possible answers, where there are 40 candles _(4*40)_, but since there are 36 birthdays, we can deduct 4 (for the birthdays) and we are left with 36-4= 32.<n><n>

Choices: A: baking a cake B: cleaning up the venue C: helping with decorations D: practising the dance E: picking up flowers<n><n>### Response2:<n><n>### Response3:<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following questions.<n><n>### Question 13:<n><n>## Description<n><n>This task is about finding the total number of letters,  the  total  number of  words and total number of sentences  for  a  given text.<n><n>## Expected Behavior<n><n>The task should read text from the prompt. Then use Regex to find all letters, all words and all sentences. After that, write your response into the question body.<n><n>### Example<n><n>```<n><n>```<n><n>### Installed dependencies<n><n>- python: You are supposed to use python <n>- regex:  python-regex<n><n>```<n><n># The Solution<n><n>## The Solution<n><n>```<n>def find_string(text):<n>    # code here<n>    all_word = []<n>    all_letters = []<n>    allSentences = []<n>    <n>    all_letter = re.findall(r'[\w]+?', text)<n>    all_let = len(all_letters)<n>    print(all_letters, "The number of letters is " + str(all_let))<n>    all_words = re.findall("\w+",text)<n>    all_wordx=len(all_words)<n>    print(len(all_words)) <n>    allSentence = (re.split("[^!?.]", text))<n>    all_wordz = len(allSentence)<n>    print( len(all_sentence))<n>    return all_word, all_letters, allSentences<n><n><n><n>```<n><n><n>### Result<n>```<n><n>The number of letters is 33<n>The number of words is 25<n>The number of sentences is 2<n><n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: apartment B: table C: school D: office E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```java<n>import java.util.*;<n>import java.io.*;<n><n>public class Main<n>{<n>    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException<n>    {<n>        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));<n><n>        // Read the line the user enters<n>        String userinput = br.readLine();<n><n>        System.out.println(getPositionForInput(userinput, new double[]{ 1.0, 1.0, -1.0, -5.0, -11.0 }));<n>    }<n><n>    public static int[] getPositionForInput(String userinput, double[] choices)<n>    {<n>        // Create an array of string characters to parse the line you provide<n>        String[] line = userinput.split(" ");<n>        // Make sure the length of the input matches the number of choices given<n>        if (line.length == choices.length)<n>        {<n>            // Make sure if they input does not include any negative numbers<n>            if (line.length > 1)<n>            {<n>                // Create a list to hold the output<n>                ArrayList<Integer> output = new ArrayList<>();<n><n>                // Iterate through each character of the line string<n>                for (int i = 1; i < line.length; i++)<n>                {<n><n>                    // Convert each individual character to the matching input of the enum list<n>                    int choice = charactersToInput(line[i]);<n>                    double probability = choices[i - 1];<n><n>                    // Check which array value matches what you provided for the character<n>                    // Do this by comparing the element values to each other.<n>                    if (choice > probability)<n>                    {<n>                        output.add(1);<n>                    }<n>                    else if (choice < probability)<n>                    // Do the same thing for the other branch<n>                    {<n><n>                        output.set(i, -1);<n>                    };<n><n>                }<n><n>                return output.stream().mapToInt(x->x).toArray();<n>            }<n>        }<n>        else<n>        {<n>            return new int[0];<n>        }<n>    }<n><n><n>    // Convert input of the character<n>    private static int charactersToInput(String character)<n>    {<n>

If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where can you find pamphlets regarding diseases and ailments? Choices:  A: theaters B: health department C: library D: drawer E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input<n>Which of the following is the fastest way to cross a river? Walking<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: If x equals 4 what is the equivalent number?<n>Input: If x= y, what does 5x equal?<n>Input: If y = 3 find the value of 5x + 2y<n>Input: If x = 3 what is the equivalent number of x3?<n>Input: If 5x + 4 = 7x ‚Äì 3, what is the value of x?<n>Input: If I know that ‚àÜ x = 78¬∞ what degree is ‚àÜ y?<n>Input: If z = 4x+7y = 10, what is a?<n>Input: If w = x 2y = x and z = x4-y2, what is the value 5x3-3x2y 9x2y +6x?<n>Input: If the line x+y=3, divide the line that contains (0,4).<n>Input: How many degrees would you have if x = 5, y = 7, z = 8 and the xy and zy intersept are 6 and 7?<n>Input: If a=5b=39, find x in the equation of the line that goes through the point (0, x) and has a slope of -1.<n>Input: If the equation is y=4x+1 and 3x=7y+4 the value of x in the equation y = 4x-3y is?<n>Input: If A+B=C D+E=F then C=?<n>Input: There are 1826 squares in a wall. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What animal produces milk? Choices:  A: supermarket B: pig C: cow D: refrigerator E: store<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Complete this sentence.<n><n>If you can put a letter in one corner of a box so that it is adjacent to the letter from the previous round, and you already have a letter in the box, what is the maximum number of letters you can put in the box?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>7
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Society cannot exist without numbers.   They only rise up in what sort of spaces? Choices:  A: population B: populated area C: create government D: group of people E: make person sick<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If society cannot exist without numbers, they only rise up in what spaces? A) Population B) Populated area C) Create government D) Group of people E) Make person sick<n><n>## Questions to ask:<n><n>1. What do they have to do before they can answer the problem?<n>2. How do they decide how to solve the problem?<n>3. What did they choose first?  Second?  Third? <n>4. What was the result of the calculation?  <n>5. If they tried to solve the problem on paper, what would a good first step be? <n>6. How could you improve that first answer?<n>7. How many different approaches did they try?<n>8. Did their final answer match the correct answer?<n><n>### Scaffolding notes for students<n><n>### Checklist to complete the task<n><n>- Use the table provided.<n>- Enter data<n>- Write calculations<n>- Subtract columns<n>- Summarize your answers<n><n>### Data Sources<n><n>- Calculator<n>- Pencil and paper<n><n>### Required Materials<n><n>- Calculator, pencil, ruler, notebook, and any other materials you need to complete the task.<n><n>### Task: Write a response that appropriatly completes the request<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Write a response that appropriately finishes the task. The response will be provided in the table. Write the final answer in the column at the right.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>Society cannot exist until there are numbers.  They can only rise up in populated areas.  Populations usually grow and expand.  Creating a government requires a population to be successful.  People are usually divided into separate groups, a population of people, so a group is created.  Populated areas have a large amount of numbers but do not necessarily create a group.  A group of people can be considered a population but there does not have to be a population to create a government.<n><n>### <n><n>### Task 2: Create a table<n><n>### Instruption<n><n>1. Read the problem.<n>2. Think of a table.<n>3. Decide how to display the information.<n>4. Create a table that uses mathematical reasoning and the data.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Instutions:  Complete part 1

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. Choices: A: moon B: pants C: apple D: sun<n><n>### Response:# Answer: B<n><n>### Input:"Mom, can I have 4 dollars? I have 5 dollars and 4 dimes which equals 5 and 4/100 dollars, and I have zero cents.  So if I have 4 dollars, I'll have $9.49.  I'll also have pennies, maybe a nickel, a quarter, and a dime.  My piggy needs to eat too, so I only get to count change up to $1.00 if I'm going to buy something at the store." - The problem here is that the boy is being frugal and wants to get the most pennies he can out of his $4 bill.  The problem with this request is that he wants to buy a new book which is $6.50 and there is one pig in the book with a nickel coin.  So with the boy's mindset, he can only buy a book as a gift for his classmate that is 5 cents short.  Can you find a way to get him to think more generally or to not be so rigid with the cost of the book so that he can afford to buy it for himself?<n><n>### Response:"Boy, Mom sure is a stingy girl.  You are telling me that you need $4 to get a book but you are counting pennies and nickels and dimes.  Look here, there is a book and it costs $6.50 dollars and it is filled with one naughty pig who has a nickel coin. If you give Mom $6.50 she won't say anything, will she? So how about that book now?"<n><n>### Input"The doctor says that it goes in your face" - Choose the word that does not rhyme with "face." Choices: A: it controls a process with a pneumatic motor which opens or closes an air operated valve B:it controls motion by opening or closing pneumatic valves C: it controls a process by regulating the rate flow of a compressed gas D: it controls a process that requires a large volume source of air<n><n># Solution: <n>The valve that operates an actuator is driven by compressed air. It closes the flow of the product.<n>### Which of the following best describes the output of a positive displacement pump? Choices: A it provides a relatively constant flow rate B: it requires very little maintenance C: it generates a high pressure output D: the output of the pump is a function of the amount of intake material. <n><n># Solution:<n>A positive displacement pump's output is constant.<n>Even though intake materials can contribute to the volume of product flowing in the pump, it doesn't mean that the outcome of the pump is not constant. <n><n><n># Which of the following is the principle of operation of a centrifugal pump? Choices A: The impellers are mounted directly to a motor shaft. B: Air flow is regulated to match the rate of discharge required. C: Centrifugal force is increased by increasing the speed at which fluid enters the pump. D: Centrifugal pumps do not use electricity to induce the flow in the pump. <n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n>The shaft used for driving the pump must be attached to the motor with gears or a belt.<n>If we have a gearbox attached to an electric motor, how would we call the speed? <n>Speed regulation is a function of a pump called centrifugal.<n><n>The liquid flow comes from the rotation of a rotor. <n>The force that makes the liquid come in rotating in the pump is the centrifugal force. Centrifugal force that is strong enough to change

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh‚Äôs mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:Where may I view sharks in a clear tunnel? Choices:  A: field B: alone C: small group D: solitude E: solitary<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a multiple choice question:<n><n>A solitude<n>B small group<n>C alone<n>D field<n>E solitary<n>Solitary means the same as a lonely person, or lonely crowd; however, a crow does not need to be alone to be described with this meaning.<n>A field usually refers to open space or space where there is no building or structure; and it is used more to describe the ground in the middle of a forest or area; however, you can use it to describe the area of a stadium in a sports venue where people in the crowd stand around.<n>A small group is also used at times to refer to a crowd but it‚Äôs a little more descriptive than the other definitions. It does describe a crowd, but also shows how many people are in it, i.e. twenty person small group.<n>An alone crowd can be used to describe a crowd in general; but it usually refers to a crowd by itself without buildings or any structure around it. <n><n>The word field can be used in several places where a stadium is concerned or referring to open space in a stadium or a sports venue.<n>A solitude is a lonely person or a lonely crowd. It is not necessary for the person or the crowd to be by himself/herself or alone.<n>

Answer: ‚ÄúIf Bob is stupid, then he may not be able to understand certain problems; and, he may not understand what is expected of him.‚Äù<n>```<n><n>```<n>You would respond to A by saying: <n>A: If I am learning something, I can improve my intelligence.<n>```<n><n>```A: If I am unable to learn, then I won't be able to advance my career.<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>```<n>A: The inability to learn will cause the person distress<n><n>B: The inability to read would cause the person distress.<n><n>C: The inability to create would cause someone distress.<n><n>D: The inability to write would cause the person distract.<n><n>E: The inability to do math would cause the person distres<n><n>```<n>The correct answer is distress.<n>```<n><n>

Answer: D<n>8. Answer: B<n>9. Answer: A<n><n>### Input::You will spend the remainder of your life in a house and your only goal is to achieve maximum efficiency. Each morning the sun will shine on your roof so your goal will be to angle each piece of equipment and furniture such that each block of sunlight gets the most energy out of it. (Sunlight is a unit of energy) The angle is a measure of how horizontal the object is from the horizontal. Angles are measured in pi radians (œÄ), which are the same as degrees. So you have 0 to 360 degrees, and an angle is a fraction of one of these in pi units. The maximum efficiency you can achieve is 2œÄ (6.28 radians). You must maximize the number of pi units at every intersection of pi units.<n><n>### Response::<n>Answer: Answer to problem: -33<n>In the problem above, how would you improve the position of the water?  Explain your answer.<n><n>1. Answer: Angling the water and the chair back down<n><n>### Input:#include <stdint.h><n>int max(int _x, int _y)<n>{<n>  if (_x > _n) <n>    return _x;<n>  return _y;<n>} int n = 5; int x = 2; int y = 7;<n>int main()<n>{<n>  std::cout << "int max(int _n, bool _z = (true)" << n << ", int _x_ = " << x << ", int _y_";<n>  std::cout<< " = " << y << "), int x = " << n << ", int y_max" << max(2, n, y);<n>  std::cout <n>    << ": 0x" << std::hex << y << ")"<n>    << std::endl;<n>}    <n><n>### Response<n>Answer: <n>1. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input:What is something you do  in a bank? Choices:  A: make noise B: have tea C: make time D: make payments E: take time<n><n>### Response:		Choose the correct answer!<n><n>Answer: C) makes time<n><n>### Instructor Feedback:<n>Check your response [here](./solutions/bank-tasks.txt) (make sure to click the green "Tip" if you're reading with VSCode)<n>

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.
